interface.name: CertAttrSet
interface.javadoc:
This interface defines the methods required of a certificate attribute. Examples of X.509 certificate attributes are Validity, Issuer_Name, and Subject Name. A CertAttrSet may comprise one attribute or many attributes.

A CertAttrSet itself can also be comprised of other sub-sets. In the case of X.509 V3 certificates, for example, the "extensions" attribute has subattributes, such as those for KeyUsage and AuthorityKeyIdentifier. Amit Kapoor Hemma Prafullchandra CertificateException

Returns a short string describing this certificate attribute.
value of this certificate attribute in printable form.

Encodes the attribute to the output stream in a format that can be parsed by the decode method. out the OutputStream to encode the attribute to. CertificateException on encoding or validity errors. IOException on other errors.

Sets an attribute value within this CertAttrSet.
name the name of the attribute (e.g. "x509.info.key")
obj the attribute object.
CertificateException on attribute handling errors.
IOException on other errors.

Gets an attribute value for this CertAttrSet.
name the name of the attribute to return.
CertificateException on attribute handling errors.
IOException on other errors.

Deletes an attribute value from this CertAttrSet.
name the name of the attribute to delete.
CertificateException on attribute handling errors.
IOException on other errors.

Returns an enumeration of the names of the attributes existing within this attribute.
an enumeration of the attribute names.

Returns the name (identifier) of this CertAttrSet.
the name of this CertAttrSet.
